sentences: Mid-Air Thief started his career in 2012 using the stage name Hyoo (휴).
In 2015, he changed his stage name to Public Morality (공중도덕) and released his self-titled debut album, which was nominated for Best Modern Rock Album at the 2016 Korean Music Awards.

He later changed his stage name to Mid-Air Thief after rappers Dok2 and The Quiett released a song called "Public Morality" as part of the 2016 South Korean reality competition show, Show Me the Money 5.
In 2018, Mid-Air Thief released his second album, Crumbling, which features vocals by South Korean singer Summer Soul.
In 2021, Mid-Air Thief contributed to the soundtrack for the anime series Sonny Boy.
